question: What is the difference between Duchenne muscular Dystrophy and Becker muscular dystrophy?
ideal_answer: DMD patients do not produce dystrophin whereas BMD patients produce 10-40% of the normal amount of dystrophin.

snippets.text: Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) and Becker muscular dystrophy (BMD) are X-linked recessive disorders caused by mutations of the DMD gene located at Xp21. In DMD patients, dystrophin is virtually absent; whereas BMD patients have 10% to 40% of the normal amount.
Clinical data confirm some well known differences between Duchenne and Becker muscular dystrophy concerning the age of onset, severity of disease and rate of progression.
cular dystrophy, where there is absence of dystrophin in Duchenne muscular dystrophy and reduced amounts in Becker muscular dystrophy. Not all of the
Ribosome concentration was normal in Duchenne and facioscapulohumeral and decreased in Becker muscular dystrophy.
